'''Nazareth College''' is a [[Catholic]], [[co-educational]], [[Secondary school|secondary]] [[day school]], located in [[Noble Park North, Victoria|Noble Park North]], a south eastern suburb of [[Melbourne, Victoria|Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]].
'''Nazareth College''' is a [[Catholic]], [[co-educational]], [[Secondary school|secondary]] [[day school]], located in [[Noble Park North, Victoria|Noble Park North]], a south eastern suburb of [[Melbourne, Victoria|Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]].
â
Established in 2006, the [[college]] currently caters for approximately 47 students in Years prep through twelve.
+
Established in 1986, the [[college]] currently caters for approximately 1000 students in Years seven through twelve.
== History ==
== History ==
â
Nazareth was established in 2006 through the collaboration of four local parish primary-level schools: St Mark's in [[Noble Park North, Victoria|Noble Park North]], St Luke's in [[Dandenong North, Victoria|Dandenong North]], St John's in [[Wheelers Hill, Victoria|Wheelers Hill]] and St Coolbean's in [[Rowville, Victoria|Rowville]]. At the time, it was seen that there was need for a local regional college following the Catholic tradition and hence, Nazareth College was formed to cater to students from the four parishes. A majority of the students at Nazareth College are graduates of one of the parish schools listed above.
+
Nazareth was established in 1986 through the collaboration of four local parish primary-level schools: St Elizabeth's in [[Noble Park North, Victoria|Noble Park North]], St Gerard's in [[Dandenong North, Victoria|Dandenong North]], St Justin's in [[Wheelers Hill, Victoria|Wheelers Hill]] and St Simon's in [[Rowville, Victoria|Rowville]]. At the time, it was seen that there was need for a local regional college following the Catholic tradition and hence, Nazareth College was formed to cater to students from the four parishes. A majority of the students at Nazareth College are graduates of one of the parish schools listed above.
Nazareth College's past principals have been:
Nazareth College's past principals have been:

*Mr. Gregory Clarke (1997â2006)

â

+
  +
== Nazareth Cluster ==
  +
The Nazareth Cluster is a collaboration of Nazareth College and its four feeder schools: St Elizabeth's, St Gerard's, St Justin's and St Simon's. The collaboration's purpose is to ease the transition between primary school and secondary school. It is from this cluster that Nazareth College draws its priests for mass.
== Structure ==
== Structure ==
Nazareth College comprises a Middle School and Senior School. Middle School caters for the students in Years 7-9 and the Senior School caters for the students in 10-12.
Nazareth College comprises a Middle School and Senior School. Middle School caters for the students in Years 7-9 and the Senior School caters for the students in 10-12.
â
In the Middle School, students must complete the core subjects (subjects compulsory to all students including art, sex ed, music and language subjects) such as English, Mathematics, etc. At Year 9, students are given the opportunity to select subjects including a language (either Spanish or Dutch) and a variety of other subjects.
+
In the Middle School, students must complete the core subjects (subjects compulsory to all students including English, science, math, art, technology, music and language subjects) such as English, Mathematics, etc. At Year 9, students are given the opportunity to select subjects including a language (either Italian or Japanese) and a variety of other subjects.
â
In the Senior School, focus is placed upon loving Jesus.
+
In the Senior School, focus is placed upon the completion of the primarily academic [[Victorian Certificate of Education|VCE]], or the more trade orientated VCAL.
==Academics==
==Academics==
Line 44: Line 44:
==International Students==
==International Students==
â
Nazareth College has fostered a large international student program, with at least two international students studying in each of Years 11 & 12, these students come from primarily [[China]], [[Japan]] and [[Vietnam]]. To continue to foster its international links the school regularly hosts students from overseas to study at Nazareth College. Our most recongnised student was the one that got killed by that car crash. That was pretty sweet.
+
Nazareth College has fostered a large international student program, with at least twenty international students studying in each of Years 11 & 12, these students come from primarily [[China]], [[Japan]] and [[Vietnam]]. To continue to foster its international links the school regularly hosts students from overseas to study at Nazareth College.
